title: Senator Kavanagh's Carpet Recycling Bill Signed Into Law - The New York State Senate
summary: New York State has passed a law requiring carpet manufacturers to establish a recycling program for discarded carpets. This law aims to reduce landfill waste, promote a circular economy, and phase out harmful PFAS chemicals in carpets. The program is expected to increase carpet recycling rates, create jobs, and save millions of dollars in waste disposal costs.

title: Determining factors in shaping the sustainable behavior of the generation Z consumer - Frontiers
summary: This research explores the sustainable behavior of Generation Z consumers, focusing on their attitudes towards green marketing practices, environmental protection, and green product purchases. The study finds a positive relationship between Generation Z's sustainable behavior and both their satisfaction and their environmental protection activities, but no significant relationship was found between their behavior and green marketing practices, perception of environmental issues, or identification with the green consumer.

title: Hundreds of undersized lobsters found in New York City supermarkets - SeafoodSource
summary: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) inspectors discovered hundreds of undersized lobsters for sale in supermarkets in Queens and Brooklyn. The DEC issued violation notices to the supermarkets and confiscated the lobsters, which were donated to a food pantry. This incident highlights the DEC's efforts to enforce state laws protecting marine resources.
greenwashing: There is no evidence of greenwashing as the article focuses on illegal practices rather than any misleading environmental claims.

title: Implementing circular economy and sustainability policies in Rwanda: Experiences of Rwandan manufacturers with the ... - Frontiers
summary: Rwanda has banned single-use plastics, leading to challenges for manufacturers who must transition to environmentally friendly alternatives.  These challenges include finding affordable and reliable alternatives, securing funding for new technologies, and navigating complex regulatory processes. While the government has provided some support, businesses require more financial assistance, training, and access to new technologies to successfully transition to a circular economy.
product_or_process: Production and use of alternative packaging materials for products, such as paper bags and glass bottles.

title: Flipkart Launches ‘Flipkart Green’ for Customers Looking to Adopt a Sustainable Lifestyle - Indian Retailer
summary: Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots by Amrita have launched a campaign called 'Scars are Beautiful' to celebrate postpartum bodies and stretch marks. The campaign features 11 mothers showcasing their bodies and sharing their motherhood experiences, aiming to inspire women to embrace their bodies and challenge societal beauty standards. The campaign emphasizes the strength and resilience represented by these scars, portraying them as badges of honor and reminders of the transformative power of motherhood.
